dt: {bc}of, subject to, or caused by an earthquake
{bc}of or relating to an earth vibration caused by something else (such as an explosion or the impact of a meteorite)
{bc}of or relating to a vibration on a celestial body (such as the moon) comparable to a seismic event on earth

et: Greek {it}seismos{/it} shock, earthquake, from {it}seiein{/it} to shake; probably akin to Avestan {it}thwaēshō{/it} fear
shortdef: of, subject to, or caused by an earthquake; also : of or relating to an earth vibration caused by something else (such as an explosion or the impact of a meteorite)
of or relating to a vibration on a celestial body (such as the moon) comparable to a seismic event on earth
having a strong or widespread impact : earthshaking

dt.t: The discovery caused a {it}seismic shift{/it} in public attitudes.
